sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"希望"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: desire, wish, hope, expect, want, long
means: desire ： 语气较正式庄重，着重渴望的力量与热切，常含有强烈的意图和目的。
wish ： 语气较弱，多指难于实现或不可能实现的愿望。
hope ： 指对愿望实现有一定信心的希望。
expect ： 通常指有很大程度的把握，但仍含有预料之意，或预计某事或某行动的发生。
want ： 一般指所想要的东西是切望得到的东西，能弥补实际需要。
long ： 语气强，指极殷切地盼望着，这种盼望侧重于很难或不可能得到的东西。有时也指一般愿望，但含一定感情色彩。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"渴望"之意。
means: yearn ： 通常指急迫不安地渴望或向往，着重怀有柔情或热情。
long ： 指诚心诚意地渴望某事或物。
thirst ： 原义指对食物或饮料的渴求，引申指全力以求。

list.explanation: 远不，断然不，根本不，一点儿也不

example.en: They couldn't solve the problem by a long shot.
example.zh: 他们根本不可能解决这个问题。

example.en: A: Have any cash? B: Not by a long shot.
example.zh: 甲:有现钱吗？乙:一点儿也没有。

distant fishery 在远离本国海岸或渔业基地的海域，利用公海或他国资源的渔业生产活动。
finned squids 枪乌贼科（Loliginidae拉）动物的总称，属头足纲、十腕目。

entry.def: Long means a great amount of time or for a great amount of time.
entry.tran: 长时间的；长久的；长期的

example.ex: Repairs to the cable did not take too long...
example.tran: 电缆的维修没有花太长的时间。

example.ex: Have you known her parents long?...
example.tran: 你认识她父母很长时间了吗？

entry.def: A long event or period of time lasts for a great amount of time or takes a great amount of time.
entry.tran: （事件或时期）持续时间长的，花长时间的

example.ex: We had a long meeting with the attorney general...
example.tran: 我们和检察总长开了一个长会。

example.ex: She is planning a long holiday in Egypt and America...
example.tran: 她计划去埃及和美国度长假。

entry.def: You use long to ask or talk about amounts of time.

example.ex: How long have you lived around here?...
example.tran: 你住在这一带有多长时间了？

example.ex: He has been on a diet for as long as any of his friends can remember...
example.tran: 在朋友的记忆中，他一直都在节食。

entry.def: A long speech, book, film, or list contains a lot of information or a lot of items and takes a lot of time to listen to, read, watch, or deal with.

example.ex: He was making quite a long speech...
example.tran: 他的讲话颇为冗长。

example.ex: This is a long film, three hours and seven minutes.
example.tran: 这部电影较长，有3小时7分钟。

entry.def: If you describe a period of time or work as long, you mean it lasts for more hours or days than is usual, or seems to last for more time than it actually does.

example.ex: Go to sleep.  I've got a long day tomorrow...
example.tran: 睡觉吧。我明天还得忙呢。

example.ex: She was a TV reporter and worked long hours...
example.tran: 她是个电视台记者，总是工作到很晚。

entry.def: If someone has a long memory, they are able to remember things that happened far back in the past.
Long is used in expressions such as all year long ,the whole day long, and your whole life long to say and emphasize that something happens for the whole of a particular period of time.

example.ex: We played that record all night long...
example.tran: 我们整晚都在放那张唱片。

example.ex: Snow is sometimes found all summer long upon the highest peaks.
example.tran: 有时候山峰上整个夏天都有积雪。

entry.def: Something that is long measures a great distance from one end to the other.

example.ex: ...a long table...
example.tran: 长桌

example.ex: A long line of people formed outside the doctor's office...
example.tran: 医生的诊所外排了长长的一队人。

entry.def: A long distance is a great distance. A long journey or route covers a great distance.

example.ex: His destination was Chobham Common, a long way from his Cotswold home...
example.tran: 他的目的地是乔伯姆公地，那里和他在科茨沃尔德的家离得很远。

example.ex: The long journey tired him...
example.tran: 长途旅行使他疲惫不堪。

entry.def: A long piece of clothing covers the whole of someone's legs or more of their legs than usual. Clothes with long sleeves cover the whole of someone's arms.

example.ex: She is wearing a long black dress.
example.tran: 她身穿一袭黑色长裙。

example.ex: ...a long-sleeved blouse.
example.tran: 长袖女式衬衫

entry.def: You use long to talk or ask about the distance something measures from one end to the other.

example.ex: An eight-week-old embryo is only an inch long...
example.tran: 8星期大的胚胎只有一英寸长。

example.ex: How long is the tunnel?...
example.tran: 隧道有多长？

entry.def: If you describe a distance as long, you mean it seems to be greater than it actually is.

example.ex: It was five long miles to the nearest pub.
example.tran: 离最近的酒吧有长长的5英里的路程。

entry.def: If you say that something is the case as long as or so long as something else is the case, you mean that it is only the case if the second thing is the case.

example.ex: The interior minister said he would still support them, as long as they didn't break the rules...
example.tran: 内政部长说，只要他们不违规，他仍然会支持他们。

example.ex: The president need not step down so long as the elections are held under international supervision.
example.tran: 只要选举在国际监督下进行，总统就不用下台。

entry.def: If you say that someone won't be long, you mean that you think they will arrive or be back soon. If you say that it won't be long before something happens, you mean that you think it will happen soon.
entry.tran: 马上就到；很快回来；为时不远

example.ex: 'What's happened to her?' — 'I'm sure she won't be long.'...
example.tran: “她怎么回事？”——“我相信她快到了。”

example.ex: If every tune from Radiohead is as good as this one is, it can't be long before they are household names.
example.tran: 如果电台司令乐队的每首歌都像这首这么棒的话，那它很快便会家喻户晓了。

entry.def: If you say that something will happen or happened before long, you mean that it will happen or happened soon.

example.ex: German interest rates will come down before long...
example.tran: 德国的利率水平很快就会降下来。

example.ex: Before long he took over the editing of the magazine.
example.tran: 他不久就接手负责杂志的编辑工作。

entry.def: You use long live and long may in expressions such as 'long live the Queen' and 'long may it continue' to express your support for someone or something and your hope that they will live or last a long time.

example.ex: Long live freedom!...
example.tran: 自由万岁！

example.ex: It is a free world where we are all entitled to our opinions. Long may it remain so.
example.tran: 这是个自由世界，人人都有权发表自己的意见。我们愿此永恒不变。

entry.def: Something that is no longer the case used to be the case but is not the case now. You can also say that something is not the case any longer .

example.ex: Food shortages are no longer a problem...
example.tran: 食物短缺不再是个问题。

example.ex: She could no longer afford to keep him at school...
example.tran: 她已无法再供他读书。

entry.def: You can say so long as an informal way of saying goodbye.

example.ex: Well, so long, pal, see you around.
example.tran: 再见了，朋友，咱们回见。

entry.def: If you long for something, you want it very much.

example.ex: Steve longed for the good old days...
example.tran: 史蒂夫渴望重度昔日的美好时光。

example.ex: I'm longing to meet her...
example.tran: 我渴望见到她。

means.word_mean: 1. primarily temporal sense; being or indicating a relatively great or greater than average duration or passage of time or a duration as specified;
2. primarily spatial sense; of relatively great or greater than average spatial extension or extension as specified;

sentences.sentence: "a race of long gaunt men"- Sherwood Anderson

means.word_mean: 4. holding securities or commodities in expectation of a rise in prices;
5. of speech sounds (especially vowels) of relatively long duration (as e.g. the English vowel sounds in `bate', `beat', `bite', `boat', `boot')
6. used of syllables that are unaccented or of relatively long duration
8. (of memory) having greater than average range;

sentences.sentence: "took a long view of the geopolitical issues"

means.word_mean: 10. having or being more than normal or necessary:"long on brains";
1. for an extended time or at a distant time;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lang, long (adjective), lange, longe (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German lang
Old English langian 'grow long, prolong', also 'dwell in thought, yearn', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch langen 'present, offer' and German langen 'reach, extend'
